label: 妃
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the “queen-consort,” the highest ranking royal consort, of which the ritsuryô codes allowed for two. Originally they were to be women of the royal family holding the fourth or higher princely rank. But in Nara times women of the Fujiwara family also came to be named queen-consort. [律令]
